abstracts.cdata!:
Overall the outcome, and performance of
            the project were satisfactory. Nonetheless, sustainability
            is uncertain, and remains fragile, as the risks of the
            reform program are still significant. Among the lessons
            learned, macroeconomic stability stands out as the essential
            factor to attain structural reform; even under difficult
            political uncertainties, commitment to reform should be
            pursued at the highest levels of government, particularly,
            as opportunities for reform abound during a period of
            crisis, a fact demonstrated by the achievement of broad
            reforms, which might not have otherwise been possible, due
            to the strong opposition from specific interest groups. In
            addition, recovery operations require close coordination
            among the multilateral institutions, to be able to agree on
            the appropriateness of actions, and responsibilities to be
            undertaken, as conveyed by the teamwork effectiveness
            between bilateral donors, and the international financial
            institutions, whose coordination contributed to a successful operation.
